page.title: 06EFFECTS OF ELEVATION: ACTON
page.content: Prevailing winds are S.westerly. Annual rainfall is 23 ins. Precipitation occurs fairly evenly throughout the year owing to incidence of thunder- storms in summer. Local observation shows storms split up over Stour vall- ey. Storms following Suffolk bank drop rain on the higher ground of the block. This rain, falling on clay soil, ensures crops are better able to stand a drought than in some adjacent low- lying areas. In 1985 thundery activity caused severe hail damage. November and December are the wettest winter months. Winter temp. 1984/5 Mean Max 4C, Mean Min -1.75C: Summer 1985 Mean Max 21C, Mean Min 9.5C. Winter snow is brief but heavy with drift- ing. Elevation of land is important. Plant growth is delayed by up to two weeks in Spring compared with low- lying areas like Sudbury.
